alert.note: Alert for Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:58PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Graham County through 530 PM CDT... At 458 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles south of Bogue, or 9 miles southeast of Hill City, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bogue around 515 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Nicodemus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
